{{Infobox Election | election_name = United States Senate elections, 1876 | country = United States | flag_year = 1867 | type = legislative | ongoing = no | previous_election = United States Senate elections, 1874 | previous_year = 1874 | next_election = United States Senate elections, 1878 | next_year = 1878 | seats_for_election = ? seats in the [[United States Senate]] | election_date = November 1876 | image1 = | party1 = Republican Party (United States) | last_election1 = 46 seats | seats1 = 40 | seat_change1 = -6 | popular_vote1 = | percentage1 = | swing1 = | image2 = | party2 = Democratic Party (United States) | last_election2 = 28 seats | seats2 = 35 | seat_change2 = +7 | popular_vote2 = | percentage2 = | swing2 = | title = Majority Party | before_election = Republican Party | after_election = Republican Party }}
The '''United States Senate election of 1876''' was an election which had the [[Democratic Party (United States)| Democratic Party]] gain three seats in the [[United States Senate]], and which coincided with Rutherford B. Hayes narrow [[United States presidential election, 1876|election]] as President.
As this election was prior to ratification of the [[Seventeenth Amendment to the United States Constitution|seventeenth amendment]], Senators were chosen by [[State legislature (United States)|State legislatures]].
== Results == [[45th United States Congress|45th Congress]] (1877â1879)
* Majority Party: Republican (40) * Minority Party: Democratic (35) * Other Parties: Independent (1) * '''Total Seats: 76'''
